tool.name: qiime2 longitudinal nmit

param.name: table
param.label: table: FeatureTable[RelativeFrequency]
param.help: [required] Feature table to use for microbial interdependence test.

param.name: individual_id_column
param.label: individual_id_column: Str
param.help: [required] Metadata column containing IDs for individual subjects.
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

param.name: corr_method
param.label: corr_method: Str % Choices('kendall', 'pearson', 'spearman')
param.help: [default: 'kendall'] The temporal correlation test to be applied.

param.name: dist_method
param.label: dist_method: Str % Choices('fro', 'nuc')
param.help: [default: 'fro'] Temporal distance method, see numpy.linalg.norm for details.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: longitudinal nmit ========================== Nonparametric microbial interdependence test
Outputs: -------- :distance_matrix.qza: The resulting distance matrix.
|
Description: ------------ Perform nonparametric microbial interdependence test to determine longitudinal sample similarity as a function of temporal microbial composition. For more details and citation, please see doi.org/10.1002/gepi.22065
|

citations.citation: @article{cite1, author = {Zhang, Yilong and Han, Sung Won and Cox, Laura M and Li, Huilin}, doi = {10.1002/gepi.22065}, journal = {Genetic epidemiology}, number = {8}, pages = {769--778}, publisher = {Wiley Online Library}, title = {A multivariate distance-based analytic framework for microbial interdependence association test in longitudinal study}, volume = {41}, year = {2017} }
